intro: Ceraia maleolens, commonly known as the Malabar nightshade, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant produces small, egg-shaped berries that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. These berries contain toxic compounds, making the plant potentially harmful to humans and animals. It is often found in moist, shaded areas and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
